content: Dry spiced sambal with dried shrimp **Hae bee hiam** (Hokkien: 蝦米薟, POJ: *hê-bí-hiam*) is a traditional dry spiced [sambal](/wiki/Sambal) with [dried shrimp](/wiki/Dried_shrimp) (*hae bee*). It is usually made from small [dried shrimp](/wiki/Dried_shrimp), [desiccated coconut](/wiki/Desiccated_coconut) shavings, [chilli](/wiki/Chili_pepper), [tamarind](/wiki/Tamarind) (*asam*), [lemongrass](/wiki/Cymbopogon), [peppercorns](/wiki/Peppercorns), [shallots](/wiki/Shallot), [garlic](/wiki/Garlic), [turmeric](/wiki/Turmeric), [galangal](/wiki/Galangal), and various other [spices](/wiki/Spice), traditionally combined by roughly pounding in a [mortar and pestle](/wiki/Mortar_and_pestle) before [frying](/wiki/Frying). Hae bee hiam is used as a condiment or ingredient; for example as the filling in [rempah udang](/wiki/Rempah_udang).
